channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report E-2023110510
item.description:
Report E-2023110510

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-29T18:13:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-14
  • City: TROY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 14, 2023, one (1) 275-gallon tote of paint was crushed in transit and released approximately one and a half (1.5) gallons of product to the loading dock floor and pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Moran Environmental Recovery (MER) to remediate the impacted site. Crews utilized hand tools to scrape the released product off the loading dock floor. MER personnel utilized absorbent pads with a degreasing agent to collect any residual product from the impacted areas. Crews then utilized a rotary transfer pump to transfer the contents of the damaged 275-gallon tote to a new 275-gallon tote to be shipped off to its destination. MER personnel deployed granular absorbents inside the damaged tote, to solidify any remaining product, once the rotary transfer pump stopped. Crews then placed absorbent pads, under the damaged tote, and wrapped the tote in two (2) layers of poly sheeting to ensure any additional residual product was contained. All UN1263 impacted material was collected and containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2023110191
item.description:
Report E-2023110191

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: MASPETH
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a 1-gallon release of UN1263 "BC171 MEDIUM ALUMINUM" was released from (1) 1-gallon metal pail impacting the trailer floor. The pail was crushed in transit due to improper loading. The SDS was reviewed with the caller who felt comfortable cleaning the release with terminal-issued PPE. (1) 10-gallon DM overpacked with the (4) 1-gallon pails and oil dri of waste was staged and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110035
item.description:
Report E-2023110035

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-07
  • City: CASTLETON ON HUDSON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: When unloading freight from trailer material handler discovered a drum that had been forked at the bottom chime during loading and as a result the contents leaked out and contributed to the unintentional release. The spilled material had been contained in the trailer and absorbents were used to clean up the spilled material and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured drum.

item.title: Report X-2023110122
item.description:
Report X-2023110122

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-24
  • City: BUFFALO
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During Outbound Sort on 10/25/2023, a Hazmat package was discovered to be be damaged and leaking contents. Upon discovery, package was turned over to QA for further inspection. DescribePack: One gallon plastic jug of Low Temp San Chlorinated Sanitizer for Low Temp Dish Machines leaking contents from loose cap inside package DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon discovery of damaged package, QA placed it in a red plastic Fedex Ground Hazmat bin with plastic liner and staged in Hazmat cage on site for future processing

item.title: Report X-2023110083
item.description:
Report X-2023110083

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-24
  • City: BUFFALO
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During preload sort on 10/24/2023, a Hazmat package was discovered to be damaged and leaking contents. After discovery of damaged package, QA was called to collect the package and contain the leakage. DescribePack: One gallon plastic jug of Zep Concentrated Calcium Lime & Rust Stain remover leaking contents from loose cap inside package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Damaged package placed in red plastic Fedex Ground Hazmat bin with plastic liner and staged in Hazmat cage on site for future processing by QA

item.title: Report X-2023110055
item.description:
Report X-2023110055

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-20
  • City: BLAUVELT
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: 10/20/2023 at around 4am, Manager was opening trailer 818503. when opening manager noticed smoke. upon safety evaluation, QA and manger noticed smoke due to this package being crushed and spilled on other packages. DescribePack: package was under and crushed on other incompatible conveyor packages. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA and manger used neutralizer on all packages that were effected from leakage to prevent additional smoke from occuring.

item.title: Report X-2023110048

Report X-2023110048

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA got a radio call at 8pm 10-19-23 for a leaking hazmat flammable at door 310 on the 300-load side. So, Kiana got gloves, hazmat bag, hazmat tote and went to get it and quickly brought it back to be contained. DescribePack: They had loose caps that caused the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat tote, hazmat bag, and gloves.
